title: Freedom of Information Request – Recorded Information on Sheffield City Council's Involvement in Labour's National Executive Committee's Special Measures

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to make an open government request for information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. Specifically, I am seeking recorded information about when Sheffield City Council was informed by the Labour Group that Labour’s National Executive Committee would be overseeing group matters for the foreseeable future, a term referred to in the press as "special measures".
Can the council confirm if recorded information is held on this matter?
If recorded information is held, can the council please provide it? I am seeking to know:
a. If and when the council was informed of the special measures.
b. How the council was informed (e.g., by letter, email, or any other method).
c. The response from the council, if any.
Yours faithfully,
Marcus Combie

Dear Marcus Combie,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Labour Party NEC
"special measures" which we received on 07/05/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 07/06/2023, but we kindly ask for your patience
as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please do not
hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Dear FOI,
In light of comments made by Sheffield City Council to Lord Scriven on twitter and radio Sheffield.
“ Hi
@Paulscriven
Council Officers, including the Chief Executive, would not expect to be involved in, or be told about, internal Party matters, particularly around campaigning. The situation regarding the Sheffield Labour Party was confirmed to the Chief Exec on Fri 5th May 2023.”
I would like to clarify my request. I’m seeking information when the council was first informed.
And if any subsequent confirmations, briefings or discussions about the party status exist,  please state.
Yours sincerely,
Marcus Combie
